title: U.S. Pump Prices Could Soon Spike After Fresh Sanctions On Russian Oil
summary: Previously, we reported that the national average price of gasoline in the United States has dropped below $3 a gallon for the first time in years, in large part due to OPEC+ returning more barrels to the market as well as weak global demand. Average national gas prices clocked in at $2.969 per gal…

title: The U.S. LNG Boom Could Make Energy More Expensive for Americans
summary: The noticeable upward tilt in graphs of the U.S. natural gas price since April 2024 is likely a hint of things to come for U.S. consumers of energy. That's because record amounts of U.S. natural gas are now being sent abroad in the form of liquefied natural gas (LNG). And much more export capacity …

title: TotalEnergies’ $20 Billion Mozambique LNG Project Back on Track
summary: TotalEnergies and its partners are close to restarting construction and engineering work on the huge $20-billion LNG export facility in Mozambique after the companies lifted the four-year-long force majeure on the project. The French supermajor and its joint venture partners lifted the force majeur…

title: Oilfield Services Firm Petrofac Collapses
summary: After years of restructuring and cost-cutting efforts, UK-listed oilfield services group Petrofac on Monday filed for administration, following the termination of its biggest contract. Petrofac’s directors have applied to the High Court of England and Wales to appoint administrators to Petrofac, sa…

title: Bars and coins steal the shine from jewelry as Indians splurge up to $11 billion on gold this Diwali
summary: Indians bought up to $11 billion of gold in the Diwali week. But more gold was sold in the form of coins and bars than jewelry.

title: US sanctions threaten major blow to Russian oil groups Rosneft and Lukoil
summary: Decision risks upending the industry by disrupting exports and forcing both companies to adapt
